title: THE MISSING MESSENGER
subtitle: A Boy Vanishes on His Rounds—Foul Play or Flight?
teaser: Young Tommy Price, a trusted messenger for the Gazette, failed to return from his evening deliveries. His satchel was found in a riverside park, its contents scattered. The city whispers: was he taken, or did he run?
briefing: Tommy Price, age 12, vanished last night while delivering urgent news. His route took him through the city’s busiest and most shadowed streets. The Gazette offers a reward for his safe return. Was this a child’s mischief, or something more sinister?

park_scene.descriptionTemplate: a riverside park where children play

cafe_gossip.descriptionTemplate: a bustling café popular with newsboys

characters.name: Mrs. Price
characters.description: A worried mother, wringing her hands.
characters.initialDialogue: "Tommy never runs off. He’s a good boy—always home by supper."

characters.name: Constable Jones
characters.initialDialogue: "We’re searching the riverbanks. No sign yet, but we’ll find the lad."

clues.title: Tommy’s Satchel
clues.discoveryText: You find Tommy’s satchel, torn and empty, near the park bench.
clues.notebookSummary: Tommy’s satchel was found in the park, contents missing.

clues.title: Newsboy Gossip
clues.discoveryText: A newsboy claims he saw Tommy talking to a stranger by the river.
clues.notebookSummary: Tommy was seen with a stranger near the river.

clues.title: False Alarm
clues.discoveryText: Constable Jones reports a false sighting—Tommy was not at the docks.
clues.notebookSummary: Police checked the docks; Tommy was not found there.

solution.motive: The stranger lured Tommy with promises of coin, intending to rob him of the Gazette’s urgent dispatches.
solution.method: Tommy was approached in the park, his satchel stolen. Frightened, he hid until morning, then returned home.
